summary: Valentine-themed website for Ahana, featuring cute/pretty animations and gestures, with Suvo’s name shown everywhere alongside Ahana’s.

existing_features.title: Replace the current Isabella voice companion landing experience with a dedicated Valentine website page for Ahana from Suvo, making this Valentine page the default rendered route in the app.

Ensure the names “Ahana” and “Suvo” appear together throughout the Valentine website (e.g., headers, love note, CTA text, success/celebration state, and any repeating labels), using consistent formatting (for example: “Ahana & Suvo”).

Implement cute/pretty Valentine animations and “cute gestures” on the Valentine website, including at minimum: a floating hearts layer, a sparkles/particles layer, and a celebratory effect when the user accepts (e.g., confetti burst). All animations must respect the user’s “prefers-reduced-motion” setting by significantly reducing or disabling motion.

Add an interactive Valentine proposal moment/flow on the Valentine website that culminates in a clear “Yes” acceptance outcome and shows a personalized success message that includes both “Ahana” and “Suvo”. Include at least one playful micro-interaction (“cute gesture”), such as a button hover reaction, a short step-by-step reveal, or a small surprise reveal section.

Provide a theme/style selector on the Valentine website that lets the user switch between these four visual styles: (1) cute pink hearts everywhere, (2) floating hearts + sparkles, (3) anime theme, and (4) elegant romantic red theme. Theme changes should update colors/typography/decoration consistently across the page.

Establish and apply a coherent Valentine visual design system across the Valentine website (colors, typography, spacing, buttons, cards/sections) with a cute romantic aesthetic (avoid blue/purple by default). Keep all user-facing text in English.
Update the document title and meta description in the HTML entry point to reflect the Valentine website for Ahana & Suvo (instead of Isabella branding).
